snippet: A federal judge ruled that courts should hesitate before holding a government official personally responsible for violating a citizen’s rights in the context of a wartime action.
abstract: Federal Judge Rosemary M Collyer dismisses a lawsuit against top Obama administration officials that was filed by parents of three American citizens whom the government killed in drone strikes, including radical Muslim cleric Anwar al-Awlaki.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled that courts should hesitate before holding a government official personally responsible for violating a citizen’s rights in the context of a wartime action.

headline.main: Judge Dismisses Suit Against Administration Officials Over Drone Strikes
headline.print_headline: Judge Dismisses Suit Against Administration Officials Over Drone Strikes
